org.fosstrak.reader.rprm.core
Class ReaderDevice

java.lang.Object
  org.fosstrak.reader.rprm.core.ReaderDevice

public class ReaderDevice
extends java.lang.Object

The ReaderDevice object represents the Reader. It is a singleton object that shall exist by default. There are therefore no commands to create or delete it. The ReaderDevice object keeps lists of all Sources, DataSelectors, NotificationChannels, Triggers and TagSelectors known. The objects shall be added to these lists implicitly when created.

Author:
Markus Vitalini

getHandle

public final int getHandle()
Returns the reader handle. The reader handle is an arbitrary integer number, settable by the Host, to distinguish between different readers. The handle can be used as an alternative to the reader name, however, it is more code-friendly than a name and therefore intended for use by applications.

Returns:
The handle of the reader

setHandle

public final void setHandle(int handle)
Sets the handel of the reader.

Parameters:
handle - The new handle of the reader

getName

public final java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of the reader. The reader name is an arbitrary string, settable by the Host, to distinguish between different readers. The name can be used as an alternative to the Reader handle, however, it is intended to be easier understandable for the human user and therefore used for display in user interfaces.

Returns:
The name of the reader

setName

public final void setName(java.lang.String name)
Sets the name of the reader.

Parameters:
name - The new name of the reader

getRole

public final java.lang.String getRole()
Returns the Readers role. The role is an arbitrary string, settable by the Host, to identify the task or function of a reader, e.g. that this reader is at a receiving door.

Returns:
The role of the reader

setRole

public final void setRole(java.lang.String role)
Sets the role of the reader.

Parameters:
role - The new role of the reader

getTimeTicks

public final long getTimeTicks()
Returns the current uptime ticks of a reader. A compliant Reader shall have an internal clock that is reset when booted. The uptime ticks are the number of clock ticks since the reader was booted last.

Returns:
The number of clock ticks since the reader was booted last

getTimeUTC

public final java.util.Date getTimeUTC()
Returns the current absolute (UTC) time of the reader.

Returns:
The current UTC time of the reader

setTimeUTC

public final void setTimeUTC(java.util.Date utc)
Sets the UTC time of the reader.

Parameters:
utc - The new UTC of the reader

getManufacturerDescription

public final java.lang.String getManufacturerDescription()
Returns a description of the reader provided by the manufacturer. This may include information about the firmware version used and other information deemed important by the manufacturer. The format is implementation-dependent and shall be described in the reader documentation.

Returns:
The manufacturer description

setManufacturerDescription

public final void setManufacturerDescription(java.lang.String manufacturerDescription)

Parameters:
manufacturerDescription - The new manufacturer description

getCurrentSource

public final Source getCurrentSource()
Returns the current source of the reader. If the Reader supports one or more Sources then the Reader shall provide a current source. The current source can be pre-configured by the reader manufacturer or the reader can support commands that allow setting the current wource.

Returns:
The current source

setCurrentSource

public final void setCurrentSource(Source currentSource)
Sets the current source of the reader.

Parameters:
currentSource - The new current source

getCurrentDataSelector

public final DataSelector getCurrentDataSelector()
Returns the current DataSelector of the reader. Per default, this shall be a DataSelector with only the FieldName AllSupportedFields added, i.e, all supported fields and all supported event types will be reported.

Returns:
The current DataSelector of the reader

setCurrentDataSelector

public final void setCurrentDataSelector(DataSelector currentDataSelector)
Sets the current DataSelector of the reader.

Parameters:
currentDataSelector - The new current DataSelector of the reader

removeSources

public final void removeSources(Source[] sourceList)
                         throws ReaderProtocolException
Removes the specified sources from the list of sources currently associated with this reader. If one or more of the sources given are not known, or if some of the sources to be removed are currently not associated with this reader, these are ignored and all other sources shall be removed and the command shall complete successfully. But note, in case of a fixed source an exception ("ERROR_SOURCE_READ_ONLY") is thrown and none of the sources will be removed

Parameters:
sourceList - The list of sources to remove
Throws:
ReaderProtocolException - "ERROR_SOURCE_READ_ONLY"

removeAllSources

public final void removeAllSources()
Removes all Sources currently associated with this reader, except the ones marked as fixed.

getSource

public final Source getSource(java.lang.String name)
                       throws ReaderProtocolException
Returns the source with the specified name. If no source object with the given name exists, the error "ERROR_SOURCE_NOT_FOUND" is raised.

Parameters:
name - The name of the source
Returns:
The instance of the source
Throws:
ReaderProtocolException - "ERROR_SOURCE_NOT_FOUND"

getAllSources

public final Source[] getAllSources()
Returns all sources currently associated with this reader. If no sources are currently associated with the Reader, the command shall complete successfully and an empty list SHALL be returned.

Returns:
The list of sources associated with this reader

removeDataSelectors

public final void removeDataSelectors(DataSelector[] dataSelectorList)
Removes the specified DataSelectors from the list of DataSelectors currently associated with this reader. If one or more of the DataSelectors given are not known, or if some of the DataSelectors to be removed are currently not associated with this reader, these are ignored and all other DataSelectors shall be removed and the command shall complete successfully.

Parameters:
dataSelectorList - The list of DataSelectors to remove

resetToDefaultSettings

public final void resetToDefaultSettings()
                                  throws ReaderProtocolException
Resets all internal state variables of the reader to a default configuration. The documentation of the reader shall provide a definition what the default settings are

Throws:
ReaderProtocolException - "Reader not found", "Failed to read properties file", "wrong valueTrigger in property file", "wrong edgeTrigger in property file"

goodbye

public final void goodbye()
This command is used to indicate a graceful disconnect distinguishing proper system operation from a disgraceful disconnect due to loss of network connectivity, unexpected shutdown of a Host or reader, or other surprising conditions. Upon receiving the reply to this command, the connection on the control channel will be terminated by the Host.

ReaderProtocolException - "ERROR_READPOINT_NOT_FOUND"

getOperStatusAlarmControl

public final TTOperationalStatusAlarmControl getOperStatusAlarmControl()
Returns the operational status alarm control. This object controls the conditions for generating alarms alerting a manager of changes in a ReaderDevice's operational status.

Returns:
The ReaderDevice object's operStatusAlarmControl attribute.

getFreeMemory

public final long getFreeMemory()
Returns the amount of free memory available on the reader device. This value represents the number of kilobytes (KB) of Read/Write memory available to internal or external resources for buffering or other processing of information.

Returns:
The available free memory specified in kilobytes (KB)

getFreeMemoryAlarmControl

public final EdgeTriggeredAlarmControl getFreeMemoryAlarmControl()
Returns the object which controls the generation of alarms alerting a managing system of a reduction of a reader's free memory resources below a specified threshold.

Returns:
The reader's FreeMemoryAlarmControl object of type EdgeTriggeredAlarmControl.

getIOPort

public final IOPort getIOPort(java.lang.String name)
                       throws ReaderProtocolException
Returns the IO port with the specified name currently associated with this reader. If no IOPort object with the given name exists, the error ERROR_IOPORT_NOT_FOUND is raised.

Parameters:
name - A name for the IOPort object which should be retrieved from the reader.
Returns:
The named IOPort object
Throws:
ReaderProtocolException

Returns:

resetStatistics

public final void resetStatistics()
Instructs the reader to reset all statistical counters.

removeAlarmChannels

public final void removeAlarmChannels(AlarmChannel[] channels)
Removes the specified AlarmChannels from the list of AlarmChannels currently associated with this reader. If one or more of the AlarmChannels given are not known, or if some of the AlarmChannels to be removed are currently not associated with this reader, these are ignored and all other AlarmChannels shall be removed and the command shall complete successfully.

Parameters:
channels - The array with AlarmChannel objects to be removed from the reader

removeAllAlarmChannels

public final void removeAllAlarmChannels()
Removes all AlarmChannels currently associated with this reader.

getAlarmChannel

public final AlarmChannel getAlarmChannel(java.lang.String name)
                                   throws ReaderProtocolException
Returns the AlarmChannel with the specified name currently associated with this reader. If no AlarmChannel object with the given name exists, the error ERROR_CHANNEL_NOT_FOUND is raised.

Parameters:
name - The name of the AlarmChannel object which should be retrieved from the reader
Returns:
The named AlarmChannel object
Throws:
AlarmChannel - not found
ReaderProtocolException

getAllAlarmChannels

public final AlarmChannel[] getAllAlarmChannels()
Returns all AlarmChannels currently associated with the reader. If no AlarmChannels are currently associated with this object, the command complete successfully and an empty list will be returned.

Returns:
An array with all defined AlarmChannel objects for this reader

public static final void increaseOperStateSuppressions()
